message.content: This question requires knowledge about how light interacts with different surfaces. When a person turns a flashlight on and points it at a cut stone, the stone will reflect and refract the light, resulting in varied hues. The different properties of the stone and the angle of the light will cause the light to break up into different colors, creating varied hues. Option (A) is incorrect because flower patterns would not be created by shining a flashlight on a stone. Option (C) is incorrect because light does not have scents. Option (D) is unrelated and incorrect because shining a flashlight on a stone would not result in sizes of elephants.

Option (A) is incorrect because flower patterns are not related to shining a flashlight on a stone. Option (C) is incorrect because light does not emit scents. Option (D) is unrelated and does not make sense in this context.
